heading: whale of a ship
subheading: the world's largest cruise ship sets sail this weekend, leaving its yard in turku, finland, for the voyage to its new homeport in miami. voyager of the seas, a 1,035-foot behemoth, is the first of three giant liners completed for royal caribbean. it's a sign of how robust the cruising industry is these days that they'd build a ship the size of the old transatlantic liners queen mary and queen elizabeth. voyager of the seas can carry 3,000 passengers and a crew of 1,800.
author: wired staff
text: the world's largest cruise ship sets sail this weekend, leaving its yard in turku, finland, for the voyage to its new homeport in miami.  voyager of the seas, a 1,035-foot behemoth, is the first of three giant liners completed for royal caribbean. it's a sign of how robust the cruising industry is these days that they'd build a ship the size of the old transatlantic liners queen mary and queen elizabeth. voyager of the seas can carry 3,000 passengers and a crew of 1,800.
